verb.description: Cry and sniff in a feeble or fretful way.
examples: Kate started to snivel, looking sad and stunned

noun.description: An act or sound of snivelling.
examples: Lucy's torrent of howls weakened to a snivel

origin: Late Old English (recorded only in the verbal noun snyflung mucus), from snofl, in the same sense; compare with snuffle.
